ca.ualberta.cs.funtime_runtime

Class MyHistoryActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • ca.ualberta.cs.funtime_runtime.CustomActivity
        • ca.ualberta.cs.funtime_runtime.MyHistoryActivity

  • public class MyHistoryActivity
extends CustomActivity
    This class handles displaying the populated list of every question that is clicked on by the user in the main list of questions from the server. If a question is clicked in this history list, it opens the question page for the respective question.
    Author:
    cherfan

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MyHistoryActivity() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean onContextItemSelected(MenuItem item)
      On a long click if the question item is in the reading list it will give the option to remove it or if it is not in the reading list it will give the option to add the question to the reading list.
      void onCreateContextMenu(ContextMenu menu, View v, ContextMenuInfo menuInfo)
      On a long click if the question item is in the reading list it will give the option to remove it or if it is not in the reading list it will give the option to add the question to the reading list.
      boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)
      Populates the menu with options to switch activities.
      void onRestart()
      Refreshes the listview when the activity restarts in case anything changed.
      void sortDate()
      sorts questions by date
      void sortLocation()
      sorts questions by location
      void sortPhoto()
      sorts questions by whether they have a photo or not

      sorts questions by votes

    • Method Detail

      • onRestart

        public void onRestart()
        Refreshes the listview when the activity restarts in case anything changed.

      • onCreateContextMenu

        public void onCreateContextMenu(ContextMenu menu,
                       View v,
                       ContextMenuInfo menuInfo)
        On a long click if the question item is in the reading list it will give the option to remove it or if it is not in the reading list it will give the option to add the question to the reading list. This is all displayed via a context menu. Adapted from http://www.mikeplate.com/2010/01/21/show-a-context-menu-for-long -clicks-in-an-android-listview/ 2014-09-21

      • onContextItemSelected

        public boolean onContextItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        On a long click if the question item is in the reading list it will give the option to remove it or if it is not in the reading list it will give the option to add the question to the reading list. This is all displayed via a context menu.

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)
        Populates the menu with options to switch activities.
        See Also:
        android.app.Activity#onCreateOptionsMenu(android.view.Menu)
